model.chip_description: Ambiq Micro Apollo series 64/41pin Cortex-M4 MCUs http://www.ambiqmicro.com/low-power-microcontroller

field.name: STIMENA
field.description: Bit mask to enable tracing on ITM stimulus ports. One bit per stimulus port..

field.name: PRIVMASK
field.description: Bit mask to enable tracing on ITM stimulus ports. bit[0] = stimulus ports[7:0], bit[1] = stimulus ports[15:8], bit[2] = stimulus ports[23:16], bit[3] = stimulus ports[31:24].

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Set when ITM events present and being drained.

field.name: TS_PRESCALE
field.description: Timestamp prescaler: 0b00 = no prescaling 0b01 = divide by 4 0b10 = divide by 16 0b11 = divide by 64.

field.name: SWV_ENABLE
field.description: Enable SWV behavior â€“ count on TPIUEMIT and TPIUBAUD.

field.name: TS_ENABLE
field.description: Enables differential timestamps. Differential timestamps are emitted when a packet is written to the FIFO with a non-zero timestamp counter, and when the timestamp counter overflows. Timestamps are emitted during idle times after a fixed number of cycles. This provides a time reference for packets and inter-packet gaps.

field.name: ITM_ENABLE
field.description: Enable ITM. This is the master enable, and must be set before ITM Stimulus and Trace Enable registers can be written.

field.name: ACCESS
field.description: Write access to component is blocked. All writes are ignored, reads are permitted.

field.name: PRESENT
field.description: Indicates that a lock mechanism exists for this component.

field.name: BITS
field.description: NVIC_ISERn[31:0] are the set-enable bits for interrupts 31 through 0.

field.name: BITS
field.description: NVIC_ISERn[31:0] are the clear-enable bits for interrupts 31 through 0.

field.name: BITS
field.description: NVIC_ISERn[31:0] are the set-pending bits for interrupts 31 through 0.

field.name: BITS
field.description: NVIC_ISERn[31:0] are the clear-pending bits for interrupts 31 through 0.

field.name: BITS
field.description: NVIC_ISERn[31:0] are the interrupt active bits for interrupts 31 through 0.

field.name: PENDSVSET
field.description: Set the PendSV interrupt as pending.

field.name: PENDSVCLR
field.description: Remove the pending status of the PendSV exception.

field.name: PENDSTSET
field.description: Set the SysTick exception as pending.

field.name: PENDSTCLR
field.description: Remove the pending status of the SysTick exception.

field.name: ISRPREEMPT
field.description: Indicates whether a pending exception will be serviced on exit from debug halt state.

field.name: ISRPENDING
field.description: Indicates whether an external interrupt, generated by the NVIC, is pending.

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: The exception number of the highest priority pending exception.

field.name: RETTOBASE
field.description: Indicates whether there is an active exception other than the exception shown by IPSR.

field.name: VECTACTIVE
field.description: The exception number of the current executing exception.

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register.

field.name: VECTKEY
field.description: Register writes must write 0x5FA to this field, otherwise the write is ignored.

field.name: ENDIANNESS
field.description: Indicates endianness of memory architecture. (Little = 0, Big = 1)

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Priority grouping, indicates the binary point position.

field.name: SYSRESETREQ
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit reqests a local reset.

field.name: VECTCLRACTIVE
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions.

field.name: VECTRESET
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit causes a local system reset.

field.name: SEVONPEND
field.description: Determines whether a pending interrupt is a wakeup event.

field.name: SLEEPDEEP
field.description: Determines whether the sleep mode should be regular or deep sleep

field.name: SLEEPONEXIT
field.description: Determines whether the processor shoudl automatically sleep when an ISR returns to the base-level.

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Set to force 8-byte alignment for the stack pointer.

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Set to ignore precise data access faults during hard fault handlers.

field.name: DIV0TRP
field.description: Set to enable trapping on divide-by-zero.

field.name: UNALIGNTRP
field.description: Set to enable trapping of unaligned word or halfword accesses.

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Set to allow unpriveleged software to access the STIR

field.name: NONBASETHRDENA
field.description: Set to enable the processor to enter Thread mode at an execution priority other than base level.

field.name: PRI_7
field.description: Reserved for priority of system handler 7.

field.name: PRI_10
field.description: Reserved for priority of system handler 10.

field.name: PRI_9
field.description: Reserved for priority of system handler 9.

field.name: PRI_8
field.description: Reserved for priority of system handler 8.

field.name: PRI_13
field.description: Reserved for priority of system handler 13.

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register.

field.name: SVCALLPENDED
field.description: Set to pend the SVCall exception.

field.name: BUSFAULTPENDED
field.description: Set to pend the BusFault exception.

field.name: MEMFAULTPENDED
field.description: Set to pend the MemManageFault exception.

field.name: USGFAULTPENDED
field.description: Set to pend the UsageFault exception.

field.name: DIVBYZERO
field.description: Divide by zero error has occurred.

field.name: NOCP
field.description: A coprocessor access error has occurred.

field.name: INVPC
field.description: An integrity check error has occurred on EXC_RETURN.

field.name: INVSTATE
field.description: Instruction executed with invalid EPSR.T or EPSR.IT field.

field.name: UNDEFINSTR
field.description: Processor attempted to execute an undefined instruction.

field.name: LSPERR
field.description: A bus fault occurred during FP lazy state preservation.

field.name: STKERR
field.description: A derived bus fault has occurred on exception entry.

field.name: UNSTKERR
field.description: A derived bus fault has occurred on exception return.

field.name: IMPRECISERR
field.description: Imprecise data access error has occurred.

field.name: PRECISERR
field.description: A precise data access has occurrred. The faulting address is in BFAR.

field.name: IBUSERR
field.description: A bus fault on an instruction prefetch has occurred.

field.name: MLSPERR
field.description: MemManage fault occurred during FP lazy state preservation.

field.name: MSTKERR
field.description: Derived MemManage fault occurred on exception entry.

field.name: MUNSTKER
field.description: Derived MemManage fault occurred on exception return.

field.name: DACCVIOL
field.description: Data access violation. Address is in MMAR.

field.name: IACCVIOL
field.description: MPU or Execute Never default memory map access violation.

field.name: FORCED
field.description: Processor has elevated a configurable-priority fault to a HardFault.

field.name: VECTTBL
field.description: Vector table read fault has occurred.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: Address of the memory location that caused an MMU fault.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: Address of the memory location that caused an Bus fault.

field.name: CP11
field.description: Access priveleges for the Floating point unit. Must always match CP10.

field.name: CP10
field.description: Access priveleges for the Floating point unit. Must always match CP11.

register.name: DEMCR
register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

field.name: TRCENA
field.description: Global enable for all DWT and ITM features.

field.name: INTID
field.description: Vector number of the interrupt that should be triggered.

field.name: ASPEN
field.description: Set to enable automatic saving of FP registers on exception entry.

field.name: LSPEN
field.description: Set to enable lazy context saving of FP registers on exception entry.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Able to set DebugMonitor exception to pending on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: BFRDY
field.description: Able to set BusFault exception to pending on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: MMRDY
field.description: Able to set MemManage exception to pending on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: HFRDY
field.description: Able to set HardFault exception to pending on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: THREAD
field.description: Running from Thread mode on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: USER
field.description: Running from unprivileged mode on last FP stack allocation.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: Address of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on the exception stack frame.

field.name: COUNTFLAG
field.description: Returns 1 if timer counted to 0 since last time this was read.

field.name: TICKINT
field.description: Enables SysTick exception request. Software can use COUNTFLAG to determine if SysTick has ever counted to zero. 0 = counting down to zero does not assert the SysTick exception request; 1 = counting down to zero asserts the SysTick exception request.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enables the counter. 0 = counter disabled; 1 = counter enabled.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Value to load into the SYSTCVR register when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0.

field.name: CURRENT
field.description: Reads return the current value of the SysTick counter. A write of any value clears the field to 0, and also clears the SYSTCSR COUNTFLAG bit to 0.

field.name: NOREF
field.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor. 0 = reference clock provided; 1 = no reference clock provided. If your device does not provide a reference clock, the SYST_CSR.CLKSOURCE bit reads-as-one and ignores writes.

field.name: SKEW
field.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact. 0 = TENMS value is exact; 1 = TENMS value is inexact, or not given. An inexact TENMS value can affect the suitability of SysTick as a software real time clock.

field.name: TENMS
field.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors. If the value reads as zero, the calibration value is not known.

field.name: CWIDTH
field.description: One-hot representation of the current port width.

field.name: SWOSCALER
field.description: Prescaler value for the baudrate of SWO.

field.name: TXMODE
field.description: Selects the protocol used for trace output.

field.name: FIFOSZ
field.description: FIFO Size reported as a power of two. For instance, 0x3 indicates a FIFO size of 8 bytes.

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: Select the source and frequency for the ADC clock. All values not enumerated below are undefined.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: This bit selects the ADC trigger polarity for external off chip triggers.

field.name: OPMODE
field.description: Select the sample rate mode. It adjusts the current in the ADC for higher sample rates. A 12MHz ADC clock can result in a sample rate up to 1Msps depending on the trigger or repeating mode rate. A 1.5MHz ADC clock can result in a sample rate up 125K sps.NOTE: All other values not specified below are undefined.

field.name: LPMODE
field.description: Select power mode to enter between active scans.

field.name: RPTEN
field.description: This bit enables Repeating Scan Mode.

field.name: TMPSPWR
field.description: This enables power to the temperature sensor module. After setting this bit, the temperature sensor will remain powered down while the ADC is power is disconnected (i.e, when the ADC PWDSTAT is 2'b10).

field.name: ADCEN
field.description: This bit enables the ADC module. While the ADC is enabled, the ADCCFG and SLOT Configuration regsiter settings must remain stable and unchanged.

field.name: PWDSTAT
field.description: Indicates the power-status of the ADC.

field.name: SWT
field.description: Writing 0x37 to this register generates a software trigger.

field.name: ADSEL0
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL0
field.description: Select the track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL0
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN0
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 0.

field.name: SLEN0
field.description: This bit enables slot 0 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL1
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL1
field.description: Select the track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5 Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL1
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN1
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 1.

field.name: SLEN1
field.description: This bit enables slot 1 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL2
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL2
field.description: Select the track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL2
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN2
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 2.

field.name: SLEN2
field.description: This bit enables slot 2 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL3
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL3
field.description: Select the track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL3
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN3
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 3.

field.name: SLEN3
field.description: This bit enables slot 3 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL4
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL4
field.description: Select the track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL4
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN4
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 4.

field.name: SLEN4
field.description: This bit enables slot 4 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL5
field.description: Select number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL5
field.description: Select track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL5
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN5
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 5.

field.name: SLEN5
field.description: This bit enables slot 5 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL6
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL6
field.description: Select track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL6
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN6
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 6.

field.name: SLEN6
field.description: This bit enables slot 6 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ADSEL7
field.description: Select the number of measurements to average in the accumulate divide module for this slot.

field.name: THSEL7
field.description: Select track and hold delay for this slot.NOTE: The track and hold delay must be less than 50us for correct operation. When the ADC is configured to use the 1.5Mhz clock, the track and hold delay cannot exceed 64 clocks.

field.name: CHSEL7
field.description: Select one of the 13 channel inputs for this slot.

field.name: WCEN7
field.description: This bit enables the window compare function for slot 7.

field.name: SLEN7
field.description: This bit enables slot 7 for ADC conversions.

field.name: ULIM
field.description: Sets the upper limit for the wondow comparator.

field.name: LLIM
field.description: Sets the lower limit for the wondow comparator.

register.name: FIFO
register.description: FIFO Data and Valid Count Register

field.name: SLOTNUM
field.description: Slot number associated with this FIFO data.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Number of valid entries in the ADC FIFO.

field.name: OSEL
field.description: Selects the RTC oscillator (1 => LFRC, 0 => XT)

field.name: STOPRC
field.description: Stop the LFRC Oscillator to the RTC

field.name: STOPXT
field.description: Stop the XT Oscillator to the RTC

register.name: CLKKEY
register.description: Key Register for Clock Control Register

field.name: OSCF
field.description: XT Oscillator is enabled but not oscillating

field.name: HFWARMUP
field.description: XT warmup period for HFRC adjustment

field.name: CMPR1A0
field.description: Counter/Timer A0 Compare Register 1. Holds the upper limit for timer half A.

field.name: CMPR0A0
field.description: Counter/Timer A0 Compare Register 0. Holds the lower limit for timer half A.

field.name: CMPR1B0
field.description: Counter/Timer B0 Compare Register 1. Holds the upper limit for timer half B.

field.name: CMPR0B0
field.description: Counter/Timer B0 Compare Register 0. Holds the lower limit for timer half B.

field.name: ADCEN
field.description: Special Timer A3 enable for ADC function.

register.name: PADKEY
register.description: Key Register for all pad configuration registers

field.name: FIFOREM
field.description: The number of bytes remaining in the FIFO (i.e. 64-FIFOSIZ).

field.name: FIFOSIZ
field.description: The number of bytes currently in the FIFO.

field.name: CMD
field.description: This register is the I/O Command.

field.name: CMDRPT
field.description: These bits hold the Command repeat count.

field.name: IDLEST
field.description: This bit indicates if the I/O state machine is IDLE.

field.name: CMDACT
field.description: This bit indicates if the I/O Command is active.

field.name: ERR
field.description: This bit indicates if an error interrupt has occurred.

field.name: IFCEN
field.description: This bit enables the IO Master.

field.name: IFCSEL
field.description: This bit selects the I/O interface.

field.name: ARB
field.description: This is the arbitration loss interrupt.

field.name: STOP
field.description: This is the STOP command interrupt.

field.name: START
field.description: This is the START command interrupt.

field.name: ICMD
field.description: This is the illegal command interrupt.

field.name: IACC
field.description: This is the illegal FIFO access interrupt.

field.name: WTLEN
field.description: This is the write length mismatch interrupt.

field.name: NAK
field.description: This is the I2C NAK interrupt.

field.name: FOVFL
field.description: This is the Read FIFO Overflow interrupt.

field.name: FUNDFL
field.description: This is the Write FIFO Underflow interrupt.

field.name: THR
field.description: This is the FIFO Threshold interrupt.

field.name: CMDCMP
field.description: This is the Command Complete interrupt.

field.name: ARB
field.description: This is the arbitration loss interrupt.

field.name: STOP
field.description: This is the STOP command interrupt.

field.name: START
field.description: This is the START command interrupt.

field.name: ICMD
field.description: This is the illegal command interrupt.

field.name: IACC
field.description: This is the illegal FIFO access interrupt.

field.description: This is the write length mismatch interrupt.

field.description: This is the I2C NAK interrupt.

field.description: This is the Read FIFO Overflow interrupt.

field.name: FUNDFL
field.description: This is the Write FIFO Underflow interrupt.

field.name: THR
field.description: This is the FIFO Threshold interrupt.

field.description: This is the Command Complete interrupt.

field.description: This is the Read FIFO Overflow interrupt.

field.name: FUNDFL
field.description: This is the Write FIFO Underflow interrupt.

field.name: THR
field.description: This is the FIFO Threshold interrupt.

field.description: The number of bytes currently in the FIFO.

field.name: WTLEN

field.name: NAK
field.description: This is the I2C NAK interrupt.

field.name: FOVFL
field.description: This is the Read FIFO Overflow interrupt.

field.name: FUNDFL
field.description: This is the Write FIFO Underflow interrupt.

field.name: THR
field.description: This is the FIFO Threshold interrupt.

field.name: CMDCMP
field.description: This is the Command Complete interrupt.

field.name: ARB
field.description: This is the arbitration loss interrupt.

field.name: STOP
field.description: This is the STOP command interrupt.

field.name: START
field.description: This is the START command interrupt.

field.name: ICMD
field.description: This is the illegal command interrupt.

field.name: IACC
field.description: This is the illegal FIFO access interrupt.

field.name: WTLEN
field.description: This is the write length mismatch interrupt.

field.name: NAK
field.description: This is the I2C NAK interrupt.

field.name: FOVFL
field.description: This is the Read FIFO Overflow interrupt.

field.name: FUNDFL
field.description: This is the Write FIFO Underflow interrupt.

field.name: THR
field.description: This is the FIFO Threshold interrupt.

field.name: CMDCMP
field.description: This is the Command Complete interrupt.

field.name: FIFOSIZ
field.description: The number of bytes currently in the hardware FIFO.

field.name: ROBASE
field.description: Defines the read-only area. The IO Slave read-only area is situated in LRAM at (ROBASE*8) to (FIFOOBASE*8-1)

field.name: FIFOMAX
field.description: These bits hold the maximum FIFO address in 8 byte segments. It is also the beginning of the RAM area of the LRAM. Note that no RAM area is configured if FIFOMAX is set to 0x1F.

field.name: FIFOBASE
field.description: These bits hold the base address of the I/O FIFO in 8 byte segments.The IO Slave FIFO is situated in LRAM at (FIFOBASE*8) to (FIFOMAX*8-1).

field.name: IOREAD
field.description: This bitfield indicates an IO read is active.

field.name: FIFOUPD
field.description: This bit indicates that a FIFO update is underway.

field.name: FIFOINC
field.description: Increment the Overall FIFO Counter by this value on a write

field.name: STARTRD
field.description: This bit holds the cycle to initiate an I/O RAM read.

field.name: LSB
field.description: This bit selects the transfer bit ordering.

field.name: IFCSEL
field.description: This bit selects the I/O interface.

field.name: PRENC
field.description: These bits hold the priority encode of the REGACC interrupts.

field.name: IOINTSET
field.description: These bits set the IOINT interrupts when written with a 1.

field.name: IOINTCLR
field.description: This bit clears all of the IOINT interrupts when written with a 1.

field.name: IOINT
field.description: These bits read the IOINT interrupts.

field.name: IOINTEN
field.description: These bits setread the IOINT interrupt enables.

field.name: GADATA
field.description: The data supplied on the last General Address reference.

register.name: SUPPLYSRC
register.description: Memory and Core Voltage Supply Source Select Register

field.name: COREBUCKEN
field.description: Enables and Selects the Core Buck as the supply for the low-voltage power domain.

field.name: MEMBUCKEN
field.description: Enables and select the Memory Buck as the supply for the Flash and SRAM power domain.

register.name: SUPPLYSTATUS
register.description: Memory and Core Voltage Supply Source Status Register

field.name: COREBUCKON
field.description: Indicates whether the Core low-voltage domain is supplied from the LDO or the Buck.

field.name: MEMBUCKON
field.description: Indicate whether the Memory power domain is supplied from the LDO or the Buck.

register.name: SRAMPWDINSLEEP
register.description: Powerdown an SRAM Bank in Deep Sleep mode

field.name: BANK7
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 7 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK6
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 6 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK5
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 5 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK4
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 4 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK3
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 3 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK2
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 2 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK1
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 1 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

field.name: BANK0
field.description: Force SRAM Bank 0 to powerdown in deep sleep mode, causing the contents of the bank to be lost.

register.name: SRAMPWRDIS
register.description: Disables individual banks of the SRAM array

field.name: BANK7
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 7 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK6
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 6 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK5
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 5 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK4
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 4 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK3
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 3 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK2
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 2 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK1
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 1 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK0
field.description: Remove power from SRAM Bank 0 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

register.name: FLASHPWRDIS
register.description: Disables individual banks of the Flash array

field.name: BANK1
field.description: Remove power from Flash Bank 1 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

field.name: BANK0
field.description: Remove power from Flash Bank 0 which will cause an access to its address space to generate a Hard Fault.

register.name: ICODEFAULTADDR
register.description: ICODE bus address which was present when a bus fault occurred.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: The ICODE bus address observed when a Bus Fault occurred. Once an address is captured in this field, it is held until the corresponding Fault Observed bit is cleared in the FAULTSTATUS register.

register.name: DCODEFAULTADDR
register.description: DCODE bus address which was present when a bus fault occurred.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: The DCODE bus address observed when a Bus Fault occurred. Once an address is captured in this field, it is held until the corresponding Fault Observed bit is cleared in the FAULTSTATUS register.

register.name: SYSFAULTADDR
register.description: System bus address which was present when a bus fault occurred.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: SYS bus address observed when a Bus Fault occurred. Once an address is captured in this field, it is held until the corresponding Fault Observed bit is cleared in the FAULTSTATUS register.

register.name: FAULTSTATUS
register.description: Reflects the status of the bus decoders' fault detection. Any write to this register will clear all of the status bits within the register.

field.name: SYS
field.description: SYS Bus Decoder Fault Detected bit. When set, a fault has been detected, and the SYSFAULTADDR register will contain the bus address which generated the fault.

field.name: DCODE
field.description: DCODE Bus Decoder Fault Detected bit. When set, a fault has been detected, and the DCODEFAULTADDR register will contain the bus address which generated the fault.

field.name: ICODE
field.description: The ICODE Bus Decoder Fault Detected bit. When set, a fault has been detected, and the ICODEFAULTADDR register will contain the bus address which generated the fault.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Fault Capture Enable field. When set, the Fault Capture monitors are enabled and addresses which generate a hard fault are captured into the FAULTADDR registers.

register.name: TPIUCTRL
register.description: TPIU Control Register. Determines the clock enable and frequency for the M4's TPIU interface.

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: This field selects the frequency of the ARM M4 TPIU port.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: TPIU Enable field. When set, the ARM M4 TPIU is enabled and data can be streamed out of the MCU's SWO port using the ARM ITM and TPIU modules.

field.name: WDREN
field.description: Watchdog Timer Reset Enable. NOTE: The WDT module must also be configured for WDT reset.

field.name: WDRSTAT
field.description: Reset was initiated by a Watchdog Timer Reset.

field.name: DBGRSTAT
field.description: Reset was a initiated by Debugger Reset.

field.name: POIRSTAT
field.description: Reset was a initiated by Software POI Reset.

field.name: SWRSTAT
field.description: Reset was a initiated by SW POR or AIRCR Reset.

field.name: BORSTAT
field.description: Reset was initiated by a Brown-Out Reset.

field.name: PORSTAT
field.description: Reset was initiated by a Power-On Reset.

field.name: EXRSTAT
field.description: Reset was initiated by an External Reset.

field.name: CLRSTAT
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears all bits in the RST_STAT.

field.name: BODH
field.description: Enables an interrupt that triggers when VCC is below BODH level.

field.name: BODH
field.description: Enables an interrupt that triggers when VCC is below BODH level.

field.name: BODH
field.description: Enables an interrupt that triggers when VCC is below BODH level.

field.name: BODH
field.description: Enables an interrupt that triggers when VCC is below BODH level.

field.name: OEDATA
field.description: This is the overrun error indicator.

field.name: BEDATA
field.description: This is the break error indicator.

field.name: PEDATA
field.description: This is the parity error indicator.

field.name: FEDATA
field.description: This is the framing error indicator.

field.name: DATA
field.description: This is the UART data port.

field.name: OESTAT
field.description: This is the overrun error indicator.

field.name: BESTAT
field.description: This is the break error indicator.

field.name: PESTAT
field.description: This is the parity error indicator.

field.name: FESTAT
field.description: This is the framing error indicator.

field.name: RI
field.description: This bit holds the ring indicator.

field.name: TXFE
field.description: This bit holds the transmit FIFO empty indicator.

field.name: RXFF
field.description: This bit holds the receive FIFO full indicator.

field.name: TXFF
field.description: This bit holds the transmit FIFO full indicator.

field.name: RXFE
field.description: This bit holds the receive FIFO empty indicator.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: This bit holds the busy indicator.

field.name: DCD
field.description: This bit holds the data carrier detect indicator.

field.name: DSR
field.description: This bit holds the data set ready indicator.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit holds the clear to send indicator.

field.name: ILPDVSR
field.description: These bits hold the IrDA counter divisor.

field.name: DIVINT
field.description: These bits hold the baud integer divisor.

field.name: DIVFRAC
field.description: These bits hold the baud fractional divisor.

field.name: SPS
field.description: This bit holds the stick parity select.

field.name: WLEN
field.description: These bits hold the write length.

field.name: FEN
field.description: This bit holds the FIFO enable.

field.name: STP2
field.description: This bit holds the two stop bits select.

field.name: EPS
field.description: This bit holds the even parity select.

field.name: PEN
field.description: This bit holds the parity enable.

field.name: BRK
field.description: This bit holds the break set.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: This bit enables CTS hardware flow control.

field.name: RTSEN
field.description: This bit enables RTS hardware flow control.

field.name: RTS
field.description: This bit enables request to send.

field.name: DTR
field.description: This bit enables data transmit ready.

field.name: RXE
field.description: This bit is the receive enable.

field.name: TXE
field.description: This bit is the transmit enable.

field.name: LBE
field.description: This bit is the loopback enable.

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: This bitfield is the UART clock select.

field.name: CLKEN
field.description: This bit is the UART clock enable.

field.name: SIRLP
field.description: This bit is the SIR low power select.

field.name: SIREN
field.description: This bit is the SIR ENDEC enable.

field.name: UARTEN
field.description: This bit is the UART enable.

field.name: RXIFLSEL
field.description: These bits hold the receive FIFO interrupt level.

field.name: TXIFLSEL
field.description: These bits hold the transmit FIFO interrupt level.

field.name: OEIM
field.description: This bit holds the overflow interrupt enable.

field.name: BEIM
field.description: This bit holds the break error interrupt enable.

field.name: PEIM
field.description: This bit holds the parity error interrupt enable.

field.name: FEIM
field.description: This bit holds the framing error interrupt enable.

field.name: RTIM
field.description: This bit holds the receive timeout interrupt enable.

field.name: TXIM
field.description: This bit holds the transmit interrupt enable.

field.name: RXIM
field.description: This bit holds the receive interrupt enable.

field.name: DSRMIM
field.description: This bit holds the modem DSR interrupt enable.

field.name: DCDMIM
field.description: This bit holds the modem DCD interrupt enable.

field.name: CTSMIM
field.description: This bit holds the modem CTS interrupt enable.

field.name: RIMIM
field.description: This bit holds the modem RI interrupt enable.

field.name: OERIS
field.description: This bit holds the overflow interrupt status.

field.name: BERIS
field.description: This bit holds the break error interrupt status.

field.name: PERIS
field.description: This bit holds the parity error interrupt status.

field.name: FERIS
field.description: This bit holds the framing error interrupt status.

field.name: RTRIS
field.description: This bit holds the receive timeout interrupt status.

field.name: TXRIS
field.description: This bit holds the transmit interrupt status.

field.name: RXRIS
field.description: This bit holds the receive interrupt status.

field.name: DSRMRIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem DSR interrupt status.

field.name: DCDMRIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem DCD interrupt status.

field.name: CTSMRIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem CTS interrupt status.

field.name: RIMRIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem RI interrupt status.

field.name: OEMIS
field.description: This bit holds the overflow interrupt status masked.

field.name: BEMIS
field.description: This bit holds the break error interrupt status masked.

field.name: PEMIS
field.description: This bit holds the parity error interrupt status masked.

field.name: FEMIS
field.description: This bit holds the framing error interrupt status masked.

field.name: RTMIS
field.description: This bit holds the receive timeout interrupt status masked.

field.name: TXMIS
field.description: This bit holds the transmit interrupt status masked.

field.name: RXMIS
field.description: This bit holds the receive interrupt status masked.

field.name: DSRMMIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem DSR interrupt status masked.

field.name: DCDMMIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem DCD interrupt status masked.

field.name: CTSMMIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem CTS interrupt status masked.

field.name: RIMMIS
field.description: This bit holds the modem RI interrupt status masked.

field.name: OEIC
field.description: This bit holds the overflow interrupt clear.

field.name: BEIC
field.description: This bit holds the break error interrupt clear.

field.name: PEIC
field.description: This bit holds the parity error interrupt clear.

field.name: FEIC
field.description: This bit holds the framing error interrupt clear.

field.name: RTIC
field.description: This bit holds the receive timeout interrupt clear.

field.name: TXIC
field.description: This bit holds the transmit interrupt clear.

field.name: RXIC
field.description: This bit holds the receive interrupt clear.

field.name: DSRMIC
field.description: This bit holds the modem DSR interrupt clear.

field.name: DCDMIC
field.description: This bit holds the modem DCD interrupt clear.

field.name: CTSMIC
field.description: This bit holds the modem CTS interrupt clear.

field.name: RIMIC
field.description: This bit holds the modem RI interrupt clear.

field.name: LVLSEL
field.description: When the reference input NSEL is set to NSEL_DAC, this bitfield selects the voltage level for the negative input to the comparator.

field.name: NSEL
field.description: This bitfield selects the negative input to the comparator.

field.name: PSEL
field.description: This bitfield selects the positive input to the comparator.

field.name: PWDSTAT
field.description: This bit indicates the power down state of the voltage comparator.

field.name: CMPOUT
field.description: This bit is 1 if the positive input of the comparator is greater than the negative input.

register.name: PWDKEY
register.description: Key Register for Powering Down the Voltage Comparator

field.name: OUTHI
field.description: This bit is the vcompout high interrupt.

field.name: OUTLOW
field.description: This bit is the vcompout low interrupt.

field.name: OUTHI
field.description: This bit is the vcompout high interrupt.

field.name: OUTLOW
field.description: This bit is the vcompout low interrupt.

field.name: OUTHI
field.description: This bit is the vcompout high interrupt.

field.name: OUTLOW
field.description: This bit is the vcompout low interrupt.

field.name: OUTHI
field.description: This bit is the vcompout high interrupt.

field.name: OUTLOW
field.description: This bit is the vcompout low interrupt.

field.name: INTVAL
field.description: This bitfield is the compare value for counter bits 7:0 to generate a watchdog interrupt.

field.name: RESVAL
field.description: This bitfield is the compare value for counter bits 7:0 to generate a watchdog reset.

field.name: RESEN
field.description: This bitfield enables the WDT reset.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: This bitfield enables the WDT interrupt. Note : This bit must be set before the interrupt status bit will reflect a watchdog timer expiration. The IER interrupt register must also be enabled for a WDT interrupt to be sent to the NVIC.

field.name: RSTRT
field.description: Writing 0xB2 to WDTRSTRT restarts the watchdog timer.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Writing 0x3A locks the watchdog timer. Once locked, the WDTCFG reg cannot be written and WDTEN is set.
